title: What is Angular?
content:
Introduction to Angular

Angular is a powerful, open-source web application framework developed and maintained by Google. It's designed to make building dynamic, single-page applications (SPAs) easier and more efficient.

Key Features

  • Component-based architecture: Build encapsulated components that manage their own state
  • TypeScript by default: Enhanced development experience with strong typing
  • Powerful CLI: Command-line interface for scaffolding and building projects
  • Dependency Injection: Built-in dependency injection system for better testability
  • Reactive programming: Built on RxJS for handling asynchronous operations

Why Choose Angular?

Angular is particularly well-suited for:

  • Large-scale enterprise applications
  • Applications requiring complex state management
  • Projects with teams that prefer structure and conventions
  • Applications that need extensive testing capabilities

Throughout this course, you'll learn how to harness Angular's power to build modern, scalable web applications.

codeExamples.title: Angular Module Structure
codeExamples.description: Here's how Angular organizes components into modules. This is the root module of an Angular application.
